description: BUTUAN CITY- The regional office of the Commission on Population and Development has aligned its population management program right at the communities with the over-all health care program of the Department of Health. In its bid to help curb the rising cases of coronavirus disease, POPCOM-Caraga on Thursday implemented the Population, Health and...
text:
By Mike Crismundo

BUTUAN CITY - The regional office of the Commission on Population and
Development (POPCOM) has aligned its population management program right at
the communities with the over-all health care program of the Department of
Health (DOH).

In its bid to help curb the rising cases of coronavirus disease (COVID-19),
POPCOM-Caraga on Thursday implemented the Population, Health and Development
(PHD) strategy where logistical and financial support are extended to the
local government units (LGUs).

"POPCOM's strategy ensures that couples and individuals shall be assisted in
addressing their reproductive health concerns, particularly in managing
pregnancy, to guarantee the health and safety of the entire family, POPCOM 13
Regional Director Alexander A. Makinano said.

POPCOM is working with DOH in the delivery of the commodities for modern
family planning to the provincial and city health offices of Caraga region for
distribution to the health centers of the 67 towns and barangays, Makinano
told The Manila Bulletin on Thursday.

"It is expected that the health centers can continuously provide the services
to the couples and individuals especially during this national health crisis
through quality, scientific, and safer methods of family planning," he added.

Population workers and volunteers of the local governments are getting
logistical support extended by POPCOM in the delivery of services along the
population program for years. POPCOM has been extending support to local
health workers for three years now.

POPCOM's support is also designed so that LGUs can be assisted in preventing
untimely pregnancies during this crisis. Community workers and volunteers are
getting material and financial support to equip young people with appropriate
knowledge and skills in postponing their fertility concerns.

POPCOM is eyeing to expand its network to the academe, private sector, and
youth leaders in molding responsible behavior among the younger generation. In
the study commissioned by POPCOM with the University of the Philippines, a
significant proportion of young people are engaging in sexual activities which
exposed themselves to the risky complications of teenage pregnancy or sexually
transmitted infections, including HIV-AIDS.

POPCOM had earlier launched its Responsible Parenthood-Family Planning (RP-FP)
Hotlines to assist the communities in educating the public on matters
involving their safety and health during the pandemic. Trained social workers
of POPCOM will respond to the messages and calls from the public on
0995-1550746 (Globe) and 0951-0419159 (Smart) during working hours Monday to
Friday.

Some of POPCOM's personnel shall be fielded to the LGUs to assist in the
surveillance and contact tracing activities on COVID-19 cases.

In a joint memorandum with the DOH, POPCOM said that population workers and
volunteers, and other non-health personnel of the LGUs shall be mobilized for
contact tracing, Makinano said.

DOH Secretary Francisco T. Duque III has re-certified all officials and
employees of POPCOM nationwide as public health workers under the national law
for Public Health Workers.

Duque said POPCOM is engaging in health and health-related works along the
national program on family planning.

CAPTION(S):

Photo courtesy of POPCOM 13 Caraga via Mike U. Crismundo/ MANILA BULLETIN

title: POPCOM Caraga supports health services during COVID-19 pandemic.(Mindanao)
html:
By Mike Crismundo

BUTUAN CITY - The regional office of the Commission on Population and Development (POPCOM) has aligned its population management program right at the communities with the over-all health care program of the Department of Health (DOH).

In its bid to help curb the rising cases of coronavirus disease (COVID-19), POPCOM-Caraga on Thursday implemented the Population, Health and Development (PHD) strategy where logistical and financial support are extended to the local government units (LGUs).

"POPCOM's strategy ensures that couples and individuals shall be assisted in addressing their reproductive health concerns, particularly in managing pregnancy, to guarantee the health and safety of the entire family, POPCOM 13 Regional Director Alexander A. Makinano said.

POPCOM is working with DOH in the delivery of the commodities for modern family planning to the provincial and city health offices of Caraga region for distribution to the health centers of the 67 towns and barangays, Makinano told The Manila Bulletin on Thursday.

"It is expected that the health centers can continuously provide the services to the couples and individuals especially during this national health crisis through quality, scientific, and safer methods of family planning," he added.

Population workers and volunteers of the local governments are getting logistical support extended by POPCOM in the delivery of services along the population program for years. POPCOM has been extending support to local health workers for three years now.

POPCOM's support is also designed so that LGUs can be assisted in preventing untimely pregnancies during this crisis. Community workers and volunteers are getting material and financial support to equip young people with appropriate knowledge and skills in postponing their fertility concerns.

POPCOM is eyeing to expand its network to the academe, private sector, and youth leaders in molding responsible behavior among the younger generation. In the study commissioned by POPCOM with the University of the Philippines, a significant proportion of young people are engaging in sexual activities which exposed themselves to the risky complications of teenage pregnancy or sexually transmitted infections, including HIV-AIDS.

POPCOM had earlier launched its Responsible Parenthood-Family Planning (RP-FP) Hotlines to assist the communities in educating the public on matters involving their safety and health during the pandemic. Trained social workers of POPCOM will respond to the messages and calls from the public on 0995-1550746 (Globe) and 0951-0419159 (Smart) during working hours Monday to Friday.

Some of POPCOM's personnel shall be fielded to the LGUs to assist in the surveillance and contact tracing activities on COVID-19 cases.

In a joint memorandum with the DOH, POPCOM said that population workers and volunteers, and other non-health personnel of the LGUs shall be mobilized for contact tracing, Makinano said.

DOH Secretary Francisco T. Duque III has re-certified all officials and employees of POPCOM nationwide as public health workers under the national law for Public Health Workers.

Duque said POPCOM is engaging in health and health-related works along the national program on family planning.
